intro: Hypodematium eriocarpum, commonly known as the woolly bladder nut, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. Its small, greenish flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
